de.luis.kioskComponents.ePayment

Interface PayMessageListener


  • public interface PayMessageListener
    Project: LUIS ePayment

    Every command sent to the payment terminal, returns some status information, what has happened. These informations can be grouped in 3 types:

    • text based messages (receipts + display messages) (optional)
    • binary intermediate messages during the evaluation of one command (optional)
    • binary final message at the end of every command (mandatory)
    Because these informations are event driven and parallel to a given transaction, a listener interface is needed to transfer these informations to the application in a unique way.

    This class represents such an interface.

    The application has to create a class, which inplements this interface. An instance of this class can then be used to receive these events during a transaction.

    When such an implementation of the interface has an error, which might result in an non terminating loop, this behaviour will NOT influence the payment transaction itself. There is a loose interconnection between the payment trransaction and the delivery of the events. But pay attention: The delivery of further events is blocked from now on, in case of such an error.

    So it is the duty of the application to care about the correctness of the interface implementaion.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.4 $
    Author:
    M. Gelfort

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      void setDisplayMessage(java.lang.String message, int code)
      Event to receive display messages.
      void setFinalMessage(java.lang.String message)
      Event for the final message of a transaction/command.

    • Method Detail

      • setIntermediateMessage

        void setIntermediateMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Event for an intermediate message. The message is a string and has to be interpreted by the implementation.
        Parameters:
        message - The intermediate message from the payment terminal.

      • setFinalMessage

        void setFinalMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Event for the final message of a transaction/command. The message is a string and has to be interpreted by the implementation.
        Parameters:
        message - The final message from the payment terminal.

      • setReceiptMessage

        void setReceiptMessage(java.lang.String receipt,
                       short receiptType)
        This events delivers any receipt generated by the EFT to the client. The text is in unicode form.
        Parameters:
        receipt - The receipt in unicode format.
        receiptType - The type of the receipt. Possible values are PayTerminal.RECEIPT_TYPE_CUSTOMER, PayTerminal.RECEIPT_TYPE_MERCHANT and PayTerminal.RECEIPT_TYPE_ADMINISTRATOR.
        See Also:
        PayTerminal.RECEIPT_TYPE_CUSTOMER, PayTerminal.RECEIPT_TYPE_MERCHANT, PayTerminal.RECEIPT_TYPE_ADMINISTRATOR

      • setDisplayMessage

        void setDisplayMessage(java.lang.String message,
                       int code)
        Event to receive display messages. These messages are optional and have to be activated by a parameter in the PayConfiguration.
        Parameters:
        message - The text of the message.
        code - The code of the message. This code is needed to distinguish between equal texts but different contexts. The text may be equal but the code is unique for the context.
